item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://frasermarlow.com/HOA.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you have an account and you log in to this site, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Register
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
[ultimatemember form_id="14"]
Please note that by registering on this website, you agree to the Woodgate HOA sending you relevant email communications. We promise not to share your email address with any 3rd parties and will keep email updates to relevant stuff.

item.title: Real Estate Value
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
One of the HOA's main obligations is to protect the real estate value of your investment.  While no two units are the same, we hope this guide helps you in tracking the value of your real estate investment.

Please note, all this information is in the public domain already and easy to find, we just aggregated it here for reference by HOA members.  If you see any errors in the data please let the board know.

[hoa_sales_data]

item.title: Homepage
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to Woodgate Lane

The Woodgate Home Owners Association

Log In

A community of 60 Townhouses in Paoli, PA

  • 110 Woodgate Lane, Paoli PA 19301

And in local news...

Offering the best of the Main Line

conveniently located 20 miles west of Philadelphia in the highly desirable tredyffrin easttown school district

Walking distance from shops

a short walk from a main SEPTA/AMTRAK line, and restaurants, banks, a library...

Our Neighborhood

item.title: HOA Board Contact Details
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
To contact the board, please email woodgatehoa@yahoo.com  or drop us a note in the 110 mailbox (110 Woodgate Lane, Paoli, 19301)

Board Members: May 2019 - May 2020

Name

UnitBoard Member since   
Judy Beadle113 2018  
Mark Benning166 2019  
Rania El Desoki124 2018  
William Evers131 2019  
Fraser Marlow132 2019  
Steve Mullin112 (not resident) 2019  
Xindi Yu156 2019  

You can also search for other members of the Woodgate Lane community  (please note that not all members may be registered)

item.title: Woodgate rentals
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
The Woodgate Home Owners Association rules specify that only 6 units within Woodgate will be rentals at any one time.  Owners interested in renting their unit may apply to be on the waiting list.  Terms of rental can be found in the HOA governing documents.

As of June 2019, the six rental units are:

  • 112
  • 133
  • 144
  • 160
  • 162
  • 138 [pending?]
 Currently on the waiting list are: None

item.title: Recycling update
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
Please put less in the recycling! Seriously...

The recycling process in the USA has changed a lot over the years.  We can now recycle a much broader range of things than we used to. At the same time we are trying to recycle too much.   Yeah, it sounds ironic, but we have all been trained to want to recycle.  It makes us feel good about ourselves.  But the conundrum is that the more we try to recycle, the more inefficient we make the process. For our recycling to work, we have to put more in the trash and only include items in recycling which are efficient to process.   If in doubt, throw it in the garbage.  We thank you fro your help in making our recycling efficient. Waste Management provides a handy guide that you can find here.  But we have compiled the relevant highlights for you below:
  • Highlights:
    • Please do not throw anything in the recycling which is not on the list below.
    • Mixed items (containing metal and wood, or paper and plastic) should not go in our recycling.
    • Please do not put anything in our recycling that has food stains (such as Pizza boxes, or soiled food take-out containers).
    • Please do not put any plastic bags of any kind in the recycling bins.
    • Batteries, bulbs, electronics, cannot be recycled through the Woodgate bins.

What we can recycle at Woodgate:

  • METALS:
    • Aluminum cans (rinsed out)
    • Aluminum foil (needs to be wiped clean - no food residues),
    • Steel cans and Tin cans (Soup, veggies, coffee cans etc.) (rinsed out)
  • PAPER & CARDBOARD:
    • Corrugated cardboard (boxes) - please break boxes down!  No pizza boxes.
    • Magazines
    • Office paper
    • Newspaper
    • Paperboard (think cereal boxes)
    • Paper cardboard dairy and juice cartons (rinsed out)
    • Junk Mail (which apparently makes up 2.4% of all municipal waste!)
    • Phone books
  • GLASS:
    • Clear, green, brown, blue...  the color doesn't matter as long as it is a regular glass container.
    • The following CANNOT go in our recycling: Any glass contaminated with stones, dirt, and food waste;  Ceramics, such as dishware, ovenware, and decorative items;  Heat-resistant glass, such as Pyrex;  Mixed colors of broken glass;  Mirror or window glass;  Metal or plastic caps and lids (please separate these from bottles);  Crystal; Light bulbs; Cathode-ray tubes (CRTs) found in some televisions and computer monitors.
  • PLASTIC:
    • It turns out the code number on the bottom of your product is not a reliable indicator of whether something can get recycled. Recycle by shape:  Bottles, jars, and jugs – is the best way to know what is accepted.
    • Do not put any plastic bags in the recycling (garbage bags, supermarket bags) - please recycle these at ACME or some other supermarket.  Bags are the scourge of the recycling process.
    • Please ensure all plastic containers are empty and clean (especially for food or beverage containers).
[caption id="attachment_303" align="alignright" width="174"] Click on the logo to read Waste Management's guidance on recycling.[/caption] To recycle anything not on the list above, look up one of Waste Management's regional centers:
  • Norristown Transfer Station, 310 W. Washington St, Norristown, PA 19401-4623 or Delaware County
  • Transfer Station #3, Plant 3 in Broomall, PA 19007
Thanks again for he.lping us both improve the efficiency of our recycling - and avoid fines or surcharges!

item.title: Board Minutes
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
Note: This page is only visible to board members.

Woodgate Homeowners’ Association

Board of Directors Meeting Agenda: June 25 th, 2019 @ 7:00 PM / Unit 132

 Call to Order  Landscaping Service (30 Minutes)  Approval of Last Meeting Minutes  Financials (15 Minutes)

o May Financial Position Statement o Approval of Expenses o June Association Payments Status / PayHOA Adoption Rate

 Projects (30 Minutes)

o Waste Management / Recycling o Gate Replacements o WHOA Website

 Correspondence (15 Minutes)  Maintenance Needs (20 Minutes)

o Landscaping o Carpentry & Painting

 Gates: 118, 121, 135, 150

o Electrical o Waste Management / Recycling o Water Control o Streets & Parking

 Ownership Updates (10 Minutes)

o Buyer Packet / PayHOA Instructions Inclusion o Unit 111 – Contingent Sale o Units 143, 167 – Sale Pending

 Next Meeting  Adjournment  

Woodgate HOA board meeting – May 2019

Board met 5/29/2019 in unit 112 from 7:05 PM to 9:50 PM
Board of 5/22/18 - 5/29/19  -  Start  7:02 pm.           Concluded 8:15 pm.
Present - Judy Beadle, Barbara Bird, Claire Cantono, Rania El DeSoki
Absent - Grant Harris
Board of 5/29/19 - 5/xx/20  - Start 7:02 pm.               Concluded 9:50 pm.
Present: Judy Beadle (JB - 113)/ Mark Benning (MB - 166) / Rania El Desoki (RED - 124) / Fraser Marlow (FM - 132) / Steve Mullin (SM – 112) / Xindi Yu (XY – 156)
Absent:  Will Evers (WE – 131)
The Annual Meeting on 5/22/19 had a quorum and the new Board was duly elected.
Approval of Minutes: 5/10/19 and 5/22/19 Minutes approved.

The new board appointed, and approved roles as follows:

President: Mark Benning | Vice President: Xindi Yu  |  Treasurer: Rania El Desoki  |  Corresponding secretary: Judy Beadle  |  Recording secretary: Fraser Marlow. The board further recognized Steve Mullin and William Evers (absent) as member at large.

Correspondence:

Unit 129 requested having their front door repainted.  The board agreed to gather interest in having doors repainted with a view of repainting a batch of them.

Unit 145 requested removal of an overgrown forsythia.  The board approved the removal.

Unit 161 requested the planting of new bushes in front of the unit’s heat pump.  This will be done in the fall.

Financial review:

Board approved the attached April, 2019 and May, 2019 statements.

Outgoing Board Members, Barbara Bird and Claire Cantono, left the new Board's Meeting at 8:15 pm. The new Board continued at the meeting until 9:50 pm.

The board approved the following actions:

  1. A separate capital account will be opened with Vanguard.  The board will aim to maximize interest income on outstanding balances.
  2. RED, MB, XY will have access to both accounts (handoff to be organized with BB). FM to work with BB to setup secretary resolution.
  3. To transfer $50,000 from the operating account to the capital account
  4. To grant Treasurer (RED) authority to pay all recurring expenses without prior board approval (for example, insurance, utilities, trash, public storage).
  5. All non-recurring/non-habitual bills require board approval, however each officer may incur up to $500 emergency payments.

Payment of $31.78 for storage supplies was approved to JB.  JB will check on missing repayment of $123.87 for May.

Architectural Control Reporting

FM reported some gutters are overflowing in heavy rain.  FM to report specific units having this issue to the board.

The board acknowledged three vendors that will remain as approved vendors, and for whom the three bid rule will be waived.  These are Nelson Roofing, Rapushi Electriclic (Electrical), George Shegani & Sons (Masonry).  For all other contractors, three competitive bids must be obtained for work to start.

Old business:

  • The board agreed to defer any capital expenditures until the July meeting at the earliest to produce a comprehensive list of projects and prioritize.

New business:

  • Recycling: XY will call waste management to gain insights into improving our handling of recycling.
  • Website:  FM to produce use cases for review at the next board meeting.
  • JB to contact PECO for provisional summer picnic sponsorship and presentation on June 23rd.

Next meeting:

The board will reconvene on June 25th at 7:00 PM in unit 132.

item.title: For Prospective Buyers
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow

item.title: For Buyers/Renters
item.dc:creator: frasermarlow
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to Woodgate Lane.  We are a community of 60 townhouses, conveniently located in the heart of Philadelphia's Main Line in Chester county PA.  We are delighted you are considering becoming an owner or a renter.  Here we provide some background information and answer some common questions.
 
  What we love about Woodgate
  • Peaceful and safe community
  • Convenient location
  • Top-rated school district
  • Close to Valley Forge National Park
  • Run/Cycle the Chester Valley Trail
0 Townhouses 0 min walk to train station % 0 Real Estate Taxes $ 0 HOA monthly fees

Things you should know before you join us...

We have a few rules that all residents have agreed to abide by.  We recommend you read our complete rules and regulations, but here are some of the most frequently discussed items. Please be aware of these before you commit!

No Dogs

We love pets, but we have decided to be a no-dog community. No barking, no doggie litter.

No trucks overnight

We have limited parking space, so we ask trucks (including pick-ups and anything with a truck tag) not to park overnight.

Back patios

The back patios on our townhouses are owned by the HOA (but exclusively available to that house's residents). This allows us to maintain a consistent aesthetic and maintenance.

Rentals are limited

Properties in Woodgate make for a great investment. But if you plan on renting please be aware only 10% of properties (6 out of 60) can be rented at any one time.
